segment.source: Providers are Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) components that expose events to Windows Performance Recorder (WPR).
segment.target: Providers are Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) components that expose events to Windows Performance Recorder (WPR).

segment.source: You can use a single system provider and multiple event providers in a profile, including a heap event provider.
segment.target: You can use a single system provider and multiple event providers in a profile, including a heap event provider.

segment.source: A system provider provides kernel events.
segment.target: A system provider provides kernel events.

segment.source: System providers are defined by using the following:
segment.target: System providers are defined by using the following:

segment.source: Keywords for the events to be collected.
segment.target: Keywords for the events to be collected.

segment.source: Stacks from which to collect events.
segment.target: Stacks from which to collect events.

segment.source: Pool tags to indicate the component that made the allocation or the allocation type.
segment.target: Pool tags to indicate the component that made the allocation or the allocation type.

segment.source: For a description of supported system keywords, see Keyword (in SystemProvider).
segment.target: For a description of supported system keywords, see Keyword (in SystemProvider).

segment.source: You can configure event providers to provide certain types of events (among those that are supported by the provider) by specifying a hexadecimal bitmask keyword.
segment.target: You can configure event providers to provide certain types of events (among those that are supported by the provider) by specifying a hexadecimal bitmask keyword.

segment.source: Because providers support different events, there are no string constants for these keywords.
segment.target: Because providers support different events, there are no string constants for these keywords.

segment.source: Therefore, they must be hexadecimal-style strings.
segment.target: Therefore, they must be hexadecimal-style strings.
